{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3523241,"name":"Ryan zheng","username":"Rzheng1232","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/rzheng1232/{size}/182897_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-11T13:08:18.783Z","cooked":"

Hey guys!
This is my team’s first year using limelight, and I was wondering if there was any way of getting the rotation of the April tag in 3D mode. My goal is to align the robots rotation (yaw? I think) with that of the April tag, visualized below:

Untitled presentation960×540 14.8 KB

I couldn’t find a suitable method in the LimeLightHelpers wrapper that returns the April Tag’s rotation.
Thanks!

id recommend using a lookup table, get he angle based on the tag id

I would suggest using the gyro/IMU to get to the correct yaw. As @AvocadoPeel suggested have a look up table for each ID and the “target” yaw associated with each April tag. I think it will be more accurate, faster and the robot can continue to align even if the AprilTag disappears from view.

Here’s the (Java) table that WPILib provides:
AprilTagFieldLayout aprilTagFieldLayout = AprilTagFieldLayout.loadField(AprilTagFields.k2025Reefscape);
The robot might be rotated 180 degrees to face the tag.

Using the global pose and gyro is an option and depending on your goals might be the better approach. To your original question, your can use the LL data directly if you look at the botpose_targetspace yaw.

The yaw should be the robots yaw relative to the April tag.

docs.limelightvision.io

NetworkTables API | Limelight Documentation

Limelight OS features a NetworkTables 4 Client. It auto-connects

targetpose_robotspace doubleArray 3D transform of the primary in-view AprilTag in the coordinate system of the Robot (array (6)) [tx, ty, tz, pitch, yaw, roll] (meters, degrees)
botpose_targetspace doubleArray 3D transform of the robot in the coordinate system of the primary in-view AprilTag (array (6)) [tx, ty, tz, pitch, yaw, roll] (meters, degrees)
